member.name: IDirect3DTexture9.AddDirtyRect
member.summary: Adds a dirty region to a texture resource.
member.param: Pointer to a structure, specifying the dirty region to add. Specifying NULL expands the dirty region to cover the entire texture.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, the return value is D3D_OK. If the method fails, the return value can be D3DERR_INVALIDCALL.

member.name: IDirect3DTexture9.GetLevelDesc
member.summary: Retrieves a level description of a texture resource.
member.param: Identifies a level of the texture resource. This method returns a surface description for the level specified by this parameter.
Pointer to a D3DSURFACE_DESC structure, describing the returned level.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, the return value is D3D_OK. D3DERR_INVALIDCALL is returned if one of the arguments is invalid.

member.name: IDirect3DTexture9.GetSurfaceLevel
member.summary: Retrieves the specified texture surface level.
member.param: Identifies a level of the texture resource. This method returns a surface for the level specified by this parameter. The top-level surface is denoted by 0.
Address of a pointer to an interface, representing the returned surface.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, the return value is D3D_OK. If the method fails, the return value can be one D3DERR_INVALIDCALL.

member.name: IDirect3DTexture9.LockRect
member.summary: Locks a rectangle on a texture resource.
member.param: Specifies the level of the texture resource to lock.
Pointer to a D3DLOCKED_RECT structure, describing the locked region.
Pointer to a rectangle to lock. Specified by a pointer to a RECT structure. Specifying NULL for this parameter expands the dirty region to cover the entire texture.

Combination of zero or more locking flags that describe the type of lock to perform. For this method, the valid flags are:
D3DLOCK_DISCARD
D3DLOCK_NO_DIRTY_UPDATE
D3DLOCK_NOSYSLOCK
D3DLOCK_READONLY
You may not specify a subrect when using D3DLOCK_DISCARD. For a description of the flags, see D3DLOCK.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, the return value is D3D_OK. If the method fails, the return value can be D3DERR_INVALIDCALL.

member.name: IDirect3DTexture9.UnlockRect
member.summary: Unlocks a rectangle on a texture resource.
member.param: Specifies the level of the texture resource to unlock.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, the return value is D3D_OK. If the method fails, the return value can be D3DERR_INVALIDCALL.

member.name: IDirect3DTexture9
member.summary: Applications use the methods of the IDirect3DTexture9 interface to manipulate a texture resource.
